books.title: Echoes of the Labyrinth
books.author: Professor R. Elias
books.description: The first puzzle of the academy, written in twisted letters.
pages: Entry 1 - The walls speak in riddles, or so the students claim.
They say the hallway hums when no one is there.
If you listen long enough, the humming resolves into rhythm.
I believe there is order in the nonsense... perhaps a shift?
Encrypted note found behind the painting: Wklv lv wkh iluvw phvvdjh.

books.title: Notes from the East Wing
books.author: Archivist M.
books.description: Recovered fragments from a student’s journal.
pages: Day 4 - While cataloging old scrolls, I noticed a repeated pattern: A, D, G...
It's as if the letters moved forward — by three?
I remember someone muttering: 'Three steps forward reveals the path.'
Most of the scrolls were irrelevant, but one contained this odd script:
Brx duh qrw dorrqh lq wklv sodfh.

books.title: Guardian’s Whisper
books.author: Unknown
books.description: A silent voice from the walls of Room 1.
pages: I watched them walk past the old gate again.
None of them noticed the third stone out of line on the floor.
Always the number three. Three torches. Three locks. Three eyes in the statue.
Maybe it's a code. Maybe it’s always been a code.
They left a final warning scratched into the floor: Wkh grru vwdqgv ehwzhhq wkh wudxwkv.

books.title: Alchemist’s Log
books.author: Vincent E.
books.description: A personal log describing failed transformations.
pages: Attempt #14 failed again — smoke and green residue.
The flask cracked under a blue flame. Next time, less salt.
Reminder: never mix mercury with powdered moonstone.

books.title: Field Notes: Herbs & Shadows
books.author: Dr. E. Hawthorne
books.description: Sketches and field notes about plant reactions to light.
pages: Sunroot glows under moonlight, dies in daylight.
Shadowvine curls when near heat. Possesses memory-like response.
Bring samples from Room 3’s greenhouse.

books.title: Watcher’s Observation
books.author: Anonymous
pages: Subject moved at 2:13 AM. No footsteps recorded.
Window opened without a breeze. Need thermal sweep.
Possible link to lower chamber sigils.

books.title: Dust & Echoes
books.author: Lyra Vale
books.description: A collection of short poetic fragments left in the academy walls.
pages: We walked with shadows, yet they knew our names.
Dust settled not, for silence was never still.
Let the echoes sing, when memory fades.
